summary:
Dany: ... and yet I couldn’t help but feel we’re odds with one another. Why is that? Your brother.
Sansa: He loves you, you know...
body:
Dany: … and yet I couldn’t help but feel we’re odds with one another. Why is that? Your brother.

Sansa: He loves you, you know that.

Dany: That bothers you.

Sansa: Men do stupid things for women. They’re easily manipulated.

tags: i do want to preface that i'm not a fan of dany's actions as of late
and i hope that she realizes that burning people and supplies down might look cool
but is not the way to stay in power for long
however this exchange gave me hope
summary: I also have to say that I enjoyed the scene between Sansa and Dany so much. It was quite interesting to see for several...
body:
I also have to say that I enjoyed the scene between Sansa and Dany so much. It was quite interesting to see for several reasons:

1) Daenerys has finally put her political skills to use. Although she’s been in Winterfell for a short time, she’s smart enough to notice that the Nothern lords side with Sansa and she holds more respect than Jon does

2) Daenerys trying to appeal to Sansa and trying to point out the similarities between them (two strong women who were ignored and put down by men around them and who rose to respectful positions of power)

3) Sansa’s comment about how easily men can be manipulated (#westanalesbian)

4) Sansa exchanging pleasantries with Daenerys, appealing to Daenerys’ sense of pride and apologizing to her (i’m still unsure how sincere that apology was)

5) Both of them explaing their motivations behind their actions to each other

It was just a really well-done scene. It’s clear that there is still wariness between them and I don’t see how it would change (Daenerys looks like she will oppose the North’s indepence and that is the only thing Sansa will not compromise on), but it was good to see them both play The Game

It was just a really well-done scene. It’s clear that there is still wariness between them and I don’t see how it would change (Daenerys looks like she will oppose the North’s indepence and that is the only thing Sansa will not compromise on), but it was good to see them both play The Game

summary: Whenever I've thought about the Theonsa reunion during the past 3 years (which I did quite requently), I wished for Sansa to hug...
body:
Whenever I’ve thought about the Theonsa reunion during the past 3 years (which I did quite requently), I wished for Sansa to hug Theon in public, just to smother all the shit talking about him being a dickless traitor, before anyone in Winterfell could even think about it. I always wished for a public gesture of fondness and forgiveness. But I thought that would be too much to ask for or that D&D would totally forget about their soft bond at all.

I cannot believe my headcanon turns canon tonight. My shipper heart is on fire!

summary: So I've been reading the leaks and I started to feel worried. I was confident about the situation with Jaime and the way Sansa...
body:
So I’ve been reading the leaks and I started to feel worried. I was confident about the situation with Jaime and the way Sansa would react, and I read she was going to talk with Dny and a lot of stuff that worried me a lot. But after seeing the leak episode… Dear jonsa fam don’t panic, without context and without seeing the characters’ expressions and body language, we don’t know what really is going on.

English is not my first language so there will be mistakes, I apologise in advance.

Spoiler after this moment. I won’t write an analysis because I don’t have enough English level to do so. I will write about my feelings after watching the episode.

So I was really worried about how Sansa was going to react to Jaime’s arrival, she didn’t have any reason to trust him or forgive him, why would she trust him? But then I watched the episode and Brienne appeared and that was wonderful. And that was just the beginning. She dealt with Jaime’s situation wonderfully.

The conversation with Dny was another thing I was terrified about because Sansa and Dany talking and joking? But when you see the scene in the context the things are not like I thought from the leaks. Sansa is not as cold as the previous episode but she is distant and she asks about the North at the end before they are interrupted and for me, that is the best moment because Sansa is trying to protect her home. And for me, that is the most important exchange between them.

After that Sansa reunites with Theon and the situation is tense for Dny which has to see the way Sansa and Theon hug after Theon says he will fight for her. And oh my God!!! It’s so beautiful, so fucking beautiful and intense. I love their relationship and I had what I wanted till they say goodbye to each other.

I have to admit that I felt bad for Dany in this episode. She is alone in the North and feels alienated, nothing is going like she thought; nobody sees her as a saviour, or treat her like a queen, Cersei has lied to everyone. And the worst part is, suddenly, she isn’t the rightful queen of the seven kingdoms… I like Dny in this episode because she feels alone and desperate and those emotions are real and I can connect with her when I see her like that. I can see dark!Dny happening after all this and I want that to happen because it can be really interesting and heartbreaking for Dny.

There is no jonsa, but I was ready for this. Jonsa can’t appear in every episode. However, there are other things that are not good for jnerys or Dny. And in my opinion it’s good for Sansa (let’s not forget she defends Tyrions as well). Furthermore, the gendrya moment… priceless.

I want to finish this by saying that we don’t have to panic when we read any leaks, without context is difficult to know what is happening for real and they tend to ignore jonsa and Sansa in general. So let’s breathe this week and have faith.

There is still hope! 🙂

The conversation with Dny was another thing I was terrified about because Sansa and Dany talking and joking? But when you see the scene in the context the things are not like I thought from the leaks. Sansa is not as cold as the previous episode but she is distant and she asks about the North at the end before they are interrupted and for me, that is the best moment because Sansa is trying to protect her home. And for me, that is the most important exchange between them.

After that Sansa reunites with Theon and the situation is tense for Dny which has to see the way Sansa and Theon hug after Theon says he will fight for her. And oh my God!!! It’s so beautiful, so fucking beautiful and intense. I love their relationship and I had what I wanted till they say goodbye to each other.

I have to admit that I felt bad for Dany in this episode. She is alone in the North and feels alienated, nothing is going like she thought; nobody sees her as a saviour, or treat her like a queen, Cersei has lied to everyone. And the worst part is, suddenly, she isn’t the rightful queen of the seven kingdoms… I like Dny in this episode because she feels alone and desperate and those emotions are real and I can connect with her when I see her like that. I can see dark!Dny happening after all this and I want that to happen because it can be really interesting and heartbreaking for Dny.

There is no jonsa, but I was ready for this. Jonsa can’t appear in every episode. However, there are other things that are not good for jnerys or Dny. And in my opinion it’s good for Sansa (let’s not forget she defends Tyrions as well). Furthermore, the gendrya moment… priceless.

I want to finish this by saying that we don’t have to panic when we read any leaks, without context is difficult to know what is happening for real and they tend to ignore jonsa and Sansa in general. So let’s breathe this week and have faith.

There is still hope! 🙂
trail.content:
So I’ve been reading the leaks and I started to feel worried. I was confident about the situation with Jaime and the way Sansa would react, and I read she was going to talk with Dny and a lot of stuff that worried me a lot. But after seeing the leak episode… Dear jonsa fam don’t panic, without context and without seeing the characters’ expressions and body language, we don’t know what really is going on.

English is not my first language so there will be mistakes, I apologise in advance.

Spoiler after this moment. I won’t write an analysis because I don’t have enough English level to do so. I will write about my feelings after watching the episode.

So I was really worried about how Sansa was going to react to Jaime’s arrival, she didn’t have any reason to trust him or forgive him, why would she trust him? But then I watched the episode and Brienne appeared and that was wonderful. And that was just the beginning. She dealt with Jaime’s situation wonderfully.

The conversation with Dny was another thing I was terrified about because Sansa and Dany talking and joking? But when you see the scene in the context the things are not like I thought from the leaks. Sansa is not as cold as the previous episode but she is distant and she asks about the North at the end before they are interrupted and for me, that is the best moment because Sansa is trying to protect her home. And for me, that is the most important exchange between them.

After that Sansa reunites with Theon and the situation is tense for Dny which has to see the way Sansa and Theon hug after Theon says he will fight for her. And oh my God!!! It’s so beautiful, so fucking beautiful and intense. I love their relationship and I had what I wanted till they say goodbye to each other.

I have to admit that I felt bad for Dany in this episode. She is alone in the North and feels alienated, nothing is going like she thought; nobody sees her as a saviour, or treat her like a queen, Cersei has lied to everyone. And the worst part is, suddenly, she isn’t the rightful queen of the seven kingdoms… I like Dny in this episode because she feels alone and desperate and those emotions are real and I can connect with her when I see her like that. I can see dark!Dny happening after all this and I want that to happen because it can be really interesting and heartbreaking for Dny.

There is no jonsa, but I was ready for this. Jonsa can’t appear in every episode. However, there are other things that are not good for jnerys or Dny. And in my opinion it’s good for Sansa (let’s not forget she defends Tyrions as well). Furthermore, the gendrya moment… priceless.

I want to finish this by saying that we don’t have to panic when we read any leaks, without context is difficult to know what is happening for real and they tend to ignore jonsa and Sansa in general. So let’s breathe this week and have faith.

There is still hope! 🙂
trail.content_abstract:
So I’ve been reading the leaks and I started to feel worried. I was confident about the situation with Jaime and the way Sansa would react, and I read she was going to talk with Dny and a lot of stuff that worried me a lot. But after seeing the leak episode… Dear jonsa fam don’t panic, without context and without seeing the characters’ expressions and body language, we don’t know what really is going on.

English is not my first language so there will be mistakes, I apologise in advance.

Spoiler after this moment. I won’t write an analysis because I don’t have enough English level to do so. I will write about my feelings after watching the episode.

5 Moments that Make Sansa Stark a Key Player in the Game of Thrones

5 Moments that Make Sansa Stark a Key Player in the Game of Thrones

No, she’s not part of George R.R. Martin’s famous “big five” that everyone talks about, but Sansa Stark is still one of the most important players in the Game of Thrones.
